item.title: git… y u do dis
item.dc:creator: astrojansen
item.description: So I’m new to github. And not gonna lie, I feel a little ashamed about it. To me it’s always been one of those things that only the super impressive graduate students know how to use and navigate, but it just never stuck for me. Hence my embarrassingly grey contribution array. Fetching, pushing, pul ...READ MORE...

item.title: Hello, World!
item.dc:creator: astrojansen
item.description: Ah, “Hello World,” the classic opening. Today my mentors and I held Meeting 0, where we introduced ourselves and began sketching our way forward with the development of telescopy. Mainly we brainstormed what to do during the GSoC “Community Bonding Period” and came up with a nice to-do list for me t ...READ MORE...

item.title: GSoC Diaries 4.02: Wrapping up
item.dc:creator: Manan Agarwal
item.description: Hello World!The obscenity of time dumbfounds me as I find myself staring down the barrel of this final blog for my GSoC project. The past three months were filled with coding, debugging, optimising, taking feedback and working on suggestions. It feels like I just started contributing to Astropy, ind ...READ MORE...

item.title: Incorporating FITS Region and CRTF I/O and improving Regions
item.dc:creator: Sushobhana Patra
item.description: Google Summer Of Code, 2018 — Final ReportOur primary motive was to able to deal with CRTF, CASA Region Text Format (#119) in the astropy/regions package. That means, we implement a parser as well a writer for it. The grammar of this format was simple enough to not make a big deal out of it. The spe ...READ MORE...

item.title: GSoC Diaries 4.01
item.dc:creator: Manan Agarwal
item.description: Hello World!We are already more than halfway through the third and final coding phase of GSoC 2018. I have managed to successfully integrate the new Astropy tutorials theme with the existing Sphinx build process.How to make the new build?To make the Sphinx build of the Astropy tutorials with the new ...READ MORE...

item.title: Adding support for FITS Region file
item.dc:creator: Sushobhana Patra
item.description: The coding period is coming to an end in just two weeks and it is time to slowly wrap up things. In the last two weeks, we successfully merged two big pull requests . One improved the plotting methods https://github.com/astropy/regions/pull/194 and the other https://github.com/astropy/regions/pull/1 ...READ MORE...

item.title: GSoC Diaries 3.02
item.dc:creator: Manan Agarwal
item.description: Hello World!I have successfully implemented the tags feature for the Astropy tutorials. Now when you visit the tutorials landing page, you will see all the tutorials in placards with the title and an abstract. You can find all the tags in a sidebar on the left-hand side.Each tag has a corresponding ...READ MORE...

item.title: GSoC - Phase two update.
item.dc:creator: Sushobhana Patra
item.description: GSoC - Phase two update.Phase 2 couldn’t have been more interesting. My last blog post concentrated on the first two weeks of this phase. To summarize, I worked on extracting a subcube using regions.Regions (and CRTF/DS9 region files, indirectly) from a spectral_cube.SpectralCube which is basically ...READ MORE...

item.title: GSoC Diaries 3.01
item.dc:creator: Manan Agarwal
item.description: Hello World!It has been some time since I gave you any updates on Learn Astropy website, so here it is the Diary 3.01. Why 3 and not 2? Because the first coding phase of GSoC 18 has ended and in fact, we are already two weeks into the second phase. By the way, I have successfully passed the first ev ...READ MORE...

item.title: The first phase ends.
item.dc:creator: Sushobhana Patra
item.description: These last two weeks have been a roller coaster ride in terms of both of my coding and personal experiences.The first evaluations went well , and for the first time someone credited to my bank account other than my father.
